question: What is caused by loss-of-function variants in BCAS3?
ideal_answer: Bi-allelic loss-of-function variants in BCAS3 cause a syndromic neurodevelopmental disorder. BCAS3 microtubule-associated cell migration factor (BCAS3) is a large, highly conserved cytoskeletal protein previously proposed to be critical in angiogenesis and implicated in human embryogenesis and tumorigenesis.

snippets.text: Bi-allelic loss-of-function variants in BCAS3 cause a syndromic neurodevelopmental disorder.

BCAS3 microtubule-associated cell migration factor (BCAS3) is a large, highly conserved cytoskeletal protein previously proposed to be critical in angiogenesis and implicated in human embryogenesis and tumorigenesis. Here, we established BCAS3 loss-of-function variants as causative for a neurodevelopmental disorder.
Bi-allelic loss-of-function variants in BCAS3 cause a syndromic neurodevelopmental disorder
